statements.name: PROC FCMP
statements.description: Creates, tests, and stores SAS functions, CALL routines, and subroutines.

statements.name: ABORT
statements.description: Terminates the current DATA step, job, or SAS session.

statements.name: ARRAY
statements.description: Associates a name with a list of variables and constants.

statements.name: ATTRIB
statements.description: Specifies format, label, and length information for variables.

statements.name: DECLARE
statements.help:
Form 1: 
DECLARE object-type
                  object-reference
                  ;
Form 2: 
DECLARE OBJECT object-reference
                  (object-type
                  )

statements.name: DELETEFUNC
statements.description: Causes a function to be deleted from the function library that is specified in the OUTLIB option.

statements.name: DELETESUBR
statements.description: Causes a subroutine to be deleted from the function library that is specified in the OUTLIB option.

statements.name: FUNCTION
statements.description: Specifies a subroutine declaration for a routine that returns a value.

statements.name: LABEL
statements.description: Specifies a label of up to 256 characters.

statements.name: LENGTH
statements.description: Specifies the number of bytes for storing character and numeric variables, or the number of characters for storing VARCHAR variables.

statements.name: LISTFUNC
statements.description: Causes the source code for a function to be written to the SAS listing.

statements.name: LISTSUBR
statements.description: Causes the source code for a subroutine to be written to the SAS listing.

statements.name: OUTARGS
statements.description: Specifies arguments in an argument list that you want a subroutine to update.

statements.name: STATIC
statements.description: Retains a variable’s value from a previous call until the variable is reassigned.

statements.name: STRUCT
statements.description: Declares (creates) structure types that are defined in C-Language packages.

statements.name: SUBROUTINE
statements.description: Declares (creates) an independent computational block of code that you can call using a CALL statement.
